This game's story is extremely fun to play through with exploration the world of Aperature Science as its a continuation of the first game with tons of comedic relief that I really enjoyed. The singleplayer story alone is worth the purchase, but what makes this game shine even more is the co-op and the steam workshop maps that other people make. There is always content to play, so if you're looking for a really fun puzzle game to play with a good story, I highly recommend this game, especially if you've never played it. You don't [i] HAVE [/i] to play the first portal, but it's recommended too.
Very good game to play with a friend and getting a aneurism :)

Where the first game was a little rough around the edges (being a tech demo and all), this game improved and expanded on everything. The gameplay is more streamlined and moving around feels faster and less clunky. The plot and characters go deep and provide a lot of humor along the way.

The elaborate scenery is the best part about the game in my eyes. Where the original game impressed me with the behind-the-scenes industrial areas, this game embraces it even more by having you go in and out of those areas constantly. The extremely elaborate and expansive skyboxes that make you feel small really set the tone of this game.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1785506013 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1785476197

The game is longer than the previous one, but I feel like there could be even more puzzles per plot point really. It seems to me that only the minimum amount of puzzles per new component are put in, making it feel pretty condensed. That doesn't take away that this game is a sequel done extremely well. It was worth the ‚Ç¨60,- back when it came out and it's worth whatever dirt cheap price it's at right now. Oh there's also a co-op thing that I've played through many times with different people without it ever boring me. So there's that.
